#ReformPoliticalFinance The following limitations are recommended based on the current value of the naira.

(2) The maximum election expenses to be incurred by a candidate at a Presidential election shall be seven billion naira (N7,000,000,000).

#ReformPoliticalFinance (2) The Commission in consultation with the political parties and the Central Bank of Nigeria shall review the limitation in subsection (1) if it is satisfied that the value of the naira has been substantially altered.

#ReformPoliticalFinance It is probable that these figures made sense at the time the law was enacted. Subsequent erosion of value through inflation and depreciation of the Naira meant that these figures need to be reviewed.

#ReformPoliticalFinance (4) The Commission in consultation with the political parties and the Central Bank of Nigeria shall review the limitations in subsection (1) and (2) if it is satisfied that the value of the naira has been substantially altered.

#ReformPoliticalFinance (3) For the purposes of this section, a donation is money, goods or services given to a candidate or political party without charge or on non-commercial terms with value of over ten thousand naira.

#ReformPoliticalFinance give the Commission the power to review donations to candidates based on changes in the value of the naira. It is imperative to reduce the influence of money in our politics. Create a new subsection to define donation and provide sanctions for violations.

#ReformPoliticalFinance Recommended Action: Fix the limitation for political parties in the Act and grant power to the Commission to review the limitation from time to time based on changes in the value of the naira.
